dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2422 RH: Action for Dental Health Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Kelly of Illinois (for herself and Mr. Simpson) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

Additional sponsors: Mr. Ryan of Ohio, Ms. DelBene, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Mr. Payne, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Heck, Ms. Norton, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Conyers, Ms. DeLauro, Mr. Swalwell of California, Mrs. Comstock, Mr. Lowenthal, Mr. DeFazio, Ms. Sewell of Alabama, Mr. Palazzo, Mrs. Beatty, Ms. Jackson Lee, Ms. Judy Chu of California, Ms. Wilson of Florida, Mr. Butterfield, Mr. Gallego, Mr. Amodei, Mr. Lewis of Georgia, Mr. Beyer, Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico, Mr. Kilmer, Ms. Moore, Ms. Meng, Mr. Cohen, Ms. Schakowsky, Ms. Brownley of California, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, Mr. Carson of Indiana, Mr. Visclosky, Mr. Richmond, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Mr. Hastings, Mr. O'Rourke, Mr. Foster, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Walz, Mr. Brendan F. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Ms. Plaskett, Ms. Maxine Waters of California, Mr. Perlmutter, Mr. Keating, Mr. Russell, Mr. Nolan, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Loebsack, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Price of North Carolina, Mr. Vela, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Quigley, Mrs. Bustos, Mr. Higgins of New York, Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois, Ms. Stefanik, Ms. Esty of Connecticut, Mr. Barton, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Cleaver, Ms. Lofgren, Ms. McCollum, Mr. Levin, Ms. Castor of Florida, Ms. Adams, Mr. Yarmuth, Mr. Al Green of Texas, Mr. Peters, Ms. Lee, Mr. Young of Alaska, Mr. Cummings, Mr. Lipinski, and Mr. Michael F. Doyle of Pennsylvania
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 15, 2017

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to improve essential oral health care for low-income and other underserved individuals by breaking down barriers to care, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Action for Dental Health Act of 2017.

section.header: Volunteer dental projects and action for dental health program
section.text: Section 317M of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 247b–14) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (e) and (f) as subsections (f) and (g), respectively;
by inserting after subsection (d) the following new subsection:

The Secretary, in consultation with the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Administrator of the Health Resources and Service Administration, may award grants to or enter into contracts with eligible entities to collaborate with State, county, or local public officials and other stakeholders to develop and implement initiatives to accomplish any of the following goals:

subparagraph.text: To improve oral health education and dental disease prevention, including through community-wide prevention programs, through the use of dental sealants and fluoride varnish, and by increasing oral health literacy.
To reduce geographic barriers, language barriers, cultural barriers, and other similar barriers to the provision of dental services.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term eligible entity means an entity that is—

subparagraph.text: a State or local dental association;
a dental education, dental hygiene, or postdoctoral dental education program accredited by the Commission on Dental Accreditation; or

clause.text: is exempt from tax under section 501(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and
partners with public and private stakeholders to facilitate the provision of dental services for underserved populations.

paragraph.text: in subsection (g), as redesignated by paragraph (1), by striking such sums as may be necessary for each of the fiscal years 2001 through 2005 and inserting $18,000,000 for each of the fiscal years 2018 through 2022.

section.text: Section 340G of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 256g) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking and at the end; and
by adding at the end the following:
the establishment of dental homes for children and adults, including for the aged, blind, and disabled populations;
the establishment of initiatives to reduce the use of emergency departments by individuals who seek dental services more appropriately delivered in a dental primary care setting; and
the provision of dental care to nursing home residents;

paragraph.text: in subsection (f), by striking $25,000,000 for the 5-fiscal year period beginning with fiscal year 2008 and inserting $13,903,000 for each of fiscal years 2018 through 2022.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
